# What is R-Ladies?

- R-Ladies is a world-wide organization with the mission of promoting **gender diversity in the R community**  

- Started in San Francisco in 2012 and as of October 25 has **216 chapters and more than 95,000** members globally (check out rladies.org for a Shiny dashboard)

```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.align="center", out.width='70%'}

```

# R-Ladies St. Louis 

* Started in September 2017 by Jenine Harris and Chelsea West 

* 4 Meetups in 2017-2018, 5 Meetups in 2018-2019, 5 in 2019-2020, and 7 in 2020-21!

* Co-organizers for 2021-22 include:

  - Jenine Harris (Washington University)  
    
  - Mary Painter (University of Missouri)  
    
  - Shelly Cooper (Washington University)  
    
  - Crystal Lewis (University of Missouri)

# 2021 Fall Schedule

* Every Tuesday in October we will be featuring an Introductory R topic in our first ever OctobeR ExtRavaganza

  - Past: [Getting Started with R](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tbeLU71ZKkU) with **David Keyes** (R for the Rest of Us)
  
  - Past: [Intro to Tidyverse](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p6IHJ-7fqpo) with **Jess McKay** (Financial Health Network)
  
  - Today: [Exploratory Analysis with ggplot](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eTF-L2_pVrg) with **Rebecca Winkler** (UMSL)
  
  - Tuesday Oct. 26: Customizing R Markdown with **Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel** (Duke University and RStudio)
    
* RSVP for future talks on meetup.com

* We will be recording this talk
  
    - Feel free to turn off your cameras if you do not want to be recorded
    - Use the chat to ask questions (to everyone **or** directly to the host)

# About tonight's speaker

- [Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel](https://mine-cr.com) is a Professor of Practice and the Director of Undergraduate Studies at the Department of Statistical Science at Duke University

- Mine's work focuses on innovation in statistics and data science pedagogy, with an emphasis on computing, reproducible research, student-centered learning, and open-source education

- Mine is also a data scientist and professional educator at RStudio!
